analysis: The documents primarily concern the National Industrial Recovery Act of 1933 and its implementation through codes of fair competition across various industries. They include approvals of codes for specific industries like oil burners, retail meat, and infants' and children's wear, as well as appointments to boards and delegations of authority related to the Act. The documents also address safety for federal employees and the prohibition of interstate commerce of illegally produced petroleum.
title: NIRA Implementation Across Industries
